items.title: Rise Festival 2025 Rises Above Night 1 Weather Issues for an Elevated Desert Weekend With RÃ¼fÃ¼s du Sol, Calvin Harris & JohnÂ Mayer
items.summary: Happening on a dry lakebed outside Las Vegas from Oct. 3-5, the festival overcame early challenges to host a lineup of stars and a genuinely special lantern release.
items.body: As Stone Temple Pilots once said, so much depends on the weather. On Friday in the Mojave Desert, roughly 30 miles southwest of Las Vegas, Rise festival learned this the hard way, which is to say the weather did not cooperate. High winds and attendant dust forced Rise organizers to open the gates almost three hours late, with the night’s set times subsequently shuffled and the eveningâ€™s centerpiece event â€” the release of thousands of paper lanterns into the sky â€” canceled entirely. Meanwhile, reports of hourslong wait times for attendees arriving from the Vegas Strip by shuttle, plus sparse food options, were posted on social media by many incensed pass holders in the time during and after night 1. The internet pile-on was swift and harsh, and the vibe on the grounds Friday night was, in many moments, challenging. The wind and dust got in eyes and nostrils, for many necessitating face masks, with chilly winds adding a bite to the air. Some waited in long lines for drinks and food while others (like us) sailed right up with no problem. As many in the crowd stood protecting their eyes while standing amid hundreds of unlit torches, reminding us that the night’s core activâ€¦

items.title: BLACKPINKâ€™s JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: â€˜Two Voices, OneÂ Orbitâ€™
items.summary: Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai.
items.body: BLACKPINK â€™s JISOO has hinted at the release of a surprise duet this month. On Monday (Oct. 6), she unveiled a mysterious teaser image on social media, featuring a shadowed male silhouette standing behind her, with the word â€œEYESCLOSEDâ€ written across the frame â€” suggesting an upcoming collaboration. “A duet is near,” the caption reads. A second post brought the shadowed male closer to the forefront, with the caption: “two voices, one orbit. coming soon.” The mysterious collaborator has been revealed to be Zayn Malik , a former member of One Direction. In the teaser, JISOO stands in the foreground while the male figure looms behind her â€” his back turned, adding intrigue to the release. Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai. After the show, he shared a photo from the audience with the caption: â€œ@BLACKPINKOFFICIAL THANK YOU ğŸ™‚ ME & KHAI LOVED IT,â€ sparking curiosity about the connection between the two artists. The upcoming duet will mark JISOOâ€™s first new music release since her solo EP Amortage  in February, which featured tracks like â€œEarthquake,â€ â€œYour Loveâ€ and â€œHugs & Kâ€¦

items.title: AEG Signs Landmark Deal to Run U.K. Venues on â€˜Deep GreenÂ Energyâ€™
items.summary: The O2 in London and other venues are included in the initiative.
items.body: AEG Europe announced a landmark agreement on Tuesday (Oct. 7) that will make its U.K. venues the first to run on the countryâ€™s greenest energy. The European subsidiary of the global live entertainment promoter AEG has collaborated with green energy company Ecotricity on the agreement, which includes the introduction of PPAs (Power Purchase Agreements) with a 100% renewable energy supply, and is backed by hourly-matched REGOs (Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin). Related The O2’s Steve Sayer on Running a Global-Leading Venue, Setting Green Standards and The BRITs Moving to Manchester Sylvan Esso Is Pulling Its Catalog From Spotify How Blond:ish Plans to Eliminate 42 Tons of Waste From NYC Nightlife Every Year: 'This Is My Passion' The PPAs will allocate specific renewable energy assets to a number of AEGâ€™s venue portfolio in the U.K. including The O2 in London, indigo at The O2, Eventim Apollo, Watford Colosseum and University of Wolverhampton at The Halls. As a result, these venues will operate predominantly on the deepest green energy generated by solar and hydro assets and meet audit-level scrutiny and transparency standards. â€œPPAs are widely recognised aâ€¦

items.title: GLAAD eBay Auction Includes Swag Signed by Adam Lambert, Sam Smith, Barbra Streisand &Â More
items.summary: And it's all for a good cause.
items.body: Want some Barbra Streisand vinyl, signed by the legendary diva herself? Or an autographed NASA jacket from the Queen + Adam Lambert tour, signed by the onetime American Idol contestant? How about signed swag and a meet & greet with KATSEYE , Sam Smith , Brandy & Monica , Chelsea Handler or Atsuko Okatsuka? Hereâ€™s your chance. GLAAD â€“ the world’s largest LGBTQ media advocacy organization â€“ has announced an eBay auction of celebrity swag in honor of #SpiritDay. 100% of the proceeds will benefit GLAAD in support of their mission to accelerate acceptance for the LGBTQ community. Launching globally Monday (Oct. 6) and running through Oct. 16 at eBay.com/glaad , the auction will give fans the opportunity to bid on one-of-a-kind items and experiences from celebrity GLAAD supporters. Auction items include: Adam Lambert: Autographed NASA Jacket from the 2019 Queen + Adam Lambert Rhapsody Tour in Houston. Atsuko Okatsuka: Two tickets + meet & greet to see Atsuko Okatsuka on The Big Bowl Tour. Barbra Streisand: Signed vinyl of The Secret of Life: Partners, Volume Two . Brandy & Monica: Two tickets + meet & greet to see the R&B stars on The Boy Is Mine Tour. Chelâ€¦

items.title: Chandler Moore & Naomi Raine Announce Exit From Maverick City Music: â€˜Godâ€™s Not DoneÂ Yetâ€™
items.summary: The worship music collective Maverick City Music is known for songs including "Jireh."
items.body: Two of Grammy-winning worship collective Maverick City Music ‘s members, Chandler Moore and Naomi Raine, have announced their departures from the group. On Monday (Oct. 6), both artists released statements on social media, revealing their decisions to exit the group. Each artist also emphasized that they will continue to make music outside of Maverick City Music. Related Maverick City Musicâ€™s Chandler Moore Scores First Gospel Airplay No. 1 on His Own With â€˜Lead Me Onâ€™ This Taylor Swift 'The Fate of Ophelia' x 'Napoleon Dynamite' Dance Edit Is Actually Perfect Taylor Swift's 'The Fate of Ophelia' Video Is Finally Up on YouTube: Watch “These last two years I’ve been locked in on what really matters…in my life and my career,” Moore wrote on social media. “It’s been scary at times, but it’s also been full of fresh vision and real excitement about the future. With that, I’ve made the bittersweet decision to end my relationship with Maverick City Music. When we started Mav, I was grateful to have community and belonging while fulfilling my dream of making music that would help people experiencâ€¦

items.title: Central Cee Scores His First No. 1 on Rap & Rhythmic Airplay Charts With â€˜Which Oneâ€™ â€” As Drake Extends Records for Most of AllÂ Time
items.summary: Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on Rhythmic Airplay, all coming in 2025.
items.body: Drake â€™s 43rd No. 1 on Billboard â€™s Rhythmic Airplay chart is courtesy of his Central Cee collaboration â€œWhich One,â€ which lifts 2-1 on the tally dated Oct. 11. With â€œWhich One,â€ Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on the list — all coming in 2025. â€œNokiaâ€ reigned for two weeks in May, followed by the PARTYNEXTDOOR and Cash Cobain collaboration â€œSomebody Loves Meâ€ in July for a week and the three-week rule of â€œWhat Did I Miss?â€ beginning in August. That run equals Drakeâ€™s longest streak of rulers on Rhythmic Airplay. He previously went four in a row between 2018 and 2019, albeit largely as a featured act on Bad Bunny â€™s â€œMIAâ€ and Meek Mill â€™s â€œGoing Badâ€ and Chris Brown â€™s â€œNo Guidance,â€ followed by a lead-act reign of his own via â€œMoney in the Grave,â€ featuring Rick Ross . Itâ€™s also Drakeâ€™s fourth nonconsecutive calendar year with at least four No. 1s, as well as his first with four or more No. 1s as a lead act since 2016. His 43rd No. 1 extends his record for the most Rhythmic Airplay toppers in the chartâ€™s 33-year history. Most No. 1s, Rhythmic Airplay: 43, Drake 17, Rihanna 16, The Weeknd 14, Chris Brown 13, Bruno Mars 13, Lil Wayne 13, Usher 12, Beyonce 12,â€¦

items.title: Watch Jason Kelce Ask Travis Kelce Point-Blank the No. 1 Question Fans Have About TaylorÂ Swift

items.body: Jason Kelce recently sat down with Travis Kelce , Patrick Mahomes and Andy Reid to talk about the future of the Kansas City Chiefs — but first, the retired Philadelphia Eagles center had to get an important question about Taylor Swift out of the way. In a clip from the football stars’ upcoming conversation for ESPN posted Monday (Oct. 6), Jason cuts right to the chase. “Letâ€™s start with what everybody wants to know,” he says, sitting at a table across from the other three men. Related Taylor Swift Freaks Out Over Selena Gomez’s Bridal Glam in Adorable Wedding Video: ‘Look at Her!’ Taylor Swift Rebukes ‘Shockingly Offensive’ Claim She’ll Quit Music After Marrying Travis Kelce Chiefs vs. Jaguars: How to Watch the Monday Night Football Game (for a Possible Taylor Swift Sighting) “Trav, whenâ€™s the wedding?” Jason continues, earning laughs from his younger brother as well as the Chiefs quarterback and coach. â€œShut the f— up,â€ Travis replies. “This guy. I was wondering what he was going to ask.” Though the Grotesquerie star didn’t have any answers on the wedding front in the clâ€¦

items.title: World Cup 'last piece of jigsaw' for Scotland men
items.summary: Reaching next summer's World Cup is "the last piece of the jigsaw for Steve Clarke and his players", says SFA chief executive Ian Maxwell.

items.title: Earick rules out Spurs takeover bid after approach

items.title: Tandy right man to coach Wales - Henson
items.summary: Gavin Henson says Steve Tandy is now the right man to lead Wales, but warns the new head coach is facing tough times.

items.title: Tandy right man to coach Wales - Henson
items.summary: Gavin Henson says Steve Tandy is now the right man to lead Wales, but warns the new head coach is facing tough times.

items.title: Rangers 'did not get this right' with Martin
items.summary: Rangers say they "did not get this right" with Russell Martin's appointment and have started a "rigorous" recruitment drive to replace the head coach.

items.title: Rangers 'did not get Martin appointment right' with 'rigorous' recruitment under way
items.summary: Rangers say they "did not get this right" with Russell Martin's appointment and have started a "rigorous" recruitment drive to replace the head coach.

items.title: Brits inspires SA to six-wicket victory over New Zealand
items.summary: Tamzin Brits' century helps South Africa bounce back from their 10-wicket defeat against England with a comfortable six-wicket victory over New Zealand in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

items.title: England squad strength 'ridiculous' - Wales boss Bellamy
items.summary: Craig Bellamy says England's squad depth is so impressive that a boxing promoter would not pair them against his Wales side.

items.title: The Kane-inspired tactic undoing Barcelona
items.summary: Barcelona have lost their latest two games and there is a Harry Kane-inspired tactical tweak that teams are using to disrupt their defence this season.

items.title: Kogan appointed independent football regulator amid enquiry
items.summary: Sports media rights executive David Kogan is appointed as the first chair of English football's new independent regulator.

items.title: 'The most wonderful human' - Greenwood leads support for Moody after MND diagnosis
items.summary: Friend and former team-mate Will Greenwood backs Lewis Moody after the ex-England captain reveals he has motor neurone disease.

items.title: Brits century helps SA respond to England crushing
items.summary: Tazmin Brits' sublime century helps South Africa bounce back from their heavy defeat by England with a six-wicket win over New Zealand in the Women's World Cup.

items.title: Champion McLaughlin 'ready' for Formula 3 step
items.summary: British F4 champion Fionn McLaughlin believes he is "ready" to make the step up to race in Formula 3 in 2026.

items.title: Is Martin worst Rangers boss ever? What do the numbers say?
items.summary: BBC Scotland crunches the numbers behind Russell Martin's calamitous four-month tenure and looks at who Rangers could turn to next.

items.title: Norrie out in Shanghai Masters third round
items.summary: Britain's Cameron Norrie is left to rue missed opportunities as he is beaten by rising teenage star Learner Tien in the Shanghai Masters third round.

items.title: Depay late for Dutch duty after passport stolen
items.summary: Netherlands forward Memphis Depay will be late for international duty because his passport was stolen in Brazil, where he plays for Corinthians.

items.title: Scrutiny on us can only be good - England's Dean
items.summary: Spinner Charlie Dean reflects on the increased scrutiny England faced after a difficult winter and looks ahead to their second World Cup game against Bangladesh.

items.title: Red Roses winning back-to-back World Cups is RFU growth goal
items.summary: The Rugby Football Union has challenged the Red Roses to become the first England team to defend a Rugby World Cup as part of its women's game growth strategy.

items.title: MCC explains controversial Pakistan run-out call
items.summary: Cricket's lawmakers explain why the umpires eventually made the correct decision in deeming Muneeba Ali to have been run out in Pakistan's defeat by India.

items.title: Wolvaardt's 'outstanding' catch to dismiss Tahuhu
items.summary: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt produces an "outstanding" catch to dismiss New Zealand's Lea Tahuhu in their ICC Women's Cricket World Cup match in Indore.

items.title: Kelly's stunner & Macario's backheel magic among WSL best goals
items.summary: Strikes from Chloe Kelly, Mariona Caldentey and Anna Sandberg feature in this week's Women's Super League goals of the week.

items.title: Shaheed's 87-yard touchdown in NFL plays of the week
items.summary: Rashid Shaheed's 87-yard touchdown for the New Orleans Saints features in the NFL's plays of the week.

items.title: Delays, distrust, dynamic prices - how 'welcoming' will World Cup be?
items.summary: BBC Sport explores the issues which could make fans feel less than welcome when the World Cup takes place in the United States next year.

items.title: 'Despicable treatment' - Leigh make complaint to RFL over Wigan tie
items.summary: Leigh owner Derek Beaumont confirms the club have made an official complaint about their semi-final match at Wigan.

items.title: O'Reilly replaces injured James in England squad
items.summary: Manchester City defender Nico O'Reilly receives his first call-up to the England squad following the withdrawal of Reece James.

items.title: Who next for Rangers' 'poisoned chalice'?
items.summary: Rangers are seeking their fifth permanent manager in four years, but who might be in the running and who do the Ibrox club's fans want following the sacking of Russell Martin?

items.title: Palace fan gets tattoo of 5 Live FA Cup final commentary
items.summary: Crystal Palace supporter Lewis Carey has had a tattoo of all the words 5 Live commentator John Murray said in the immediate aftermath of the Eagles' historic FA Cup final win over Manchester City.

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

items.title: Lucy Bronze - the making of England's most decorated player
items.summary: This is the story of England defender Lucy Bronze, who is no stranger to winning and hopes for more success at Euro 2025.
